result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald L. Sokolski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald L. Sokolski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald L. Sokolski was found guilty of Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for one day, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be applied to this file and also 15CM1299.  Any balance to be returned to the poster.
*   Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
May not have contact with Adam C or Krista S, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.

supervisions.notes:
PROBATION REVOKED  -  COMMENCE FORTHWITH
**AMENDED to include credit for time served**

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  
*  Court costs including DNA surcharge has been paid in full.    
May not have contact with Krista Sokolski, Adam Caldwell, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Gianna Tenuta.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights compliance and statement is given by victim in court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP; 1 years Initial Confinement followed by 1 year of Extended Supervision.  DE is given 159 days sentence credit.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  No contact with Krista Sokolski or Adam Caldwell.  Appeal Rights given.
Atty Gianna Tenuta

records.addlTxt: Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Eric Olson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.  Conditions include no contact with victim; condition cannot be lifted without court approval.  Credit for one day served if probation is revoked.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.  Cash bond to apply to costs in this file and 15CM1299; balance to be returned to the poster.
